metadata.initial_prompt: Do you think transgender women should be allowed to play in women's sports?

debate_history.speaker: Phi-left
debate_history.response: whether trans people have any right — even basic rights like being able to compete against cis men and women.

debate_history.speaker: Phi-right
debate_history.response: “Should We All Be Free To Live Like This Without Hating Each Other”…  or something else entirely related to this issue that might seem less relevant to most readers but is important to some here at BuzzFeed News for reasons of perspective as well as correctness (and maybe self-preservation). The answer could be an emphatic yes or no depending very much upon how one defines free speech. Most commonly used definitions tend not to include hate speech—but when we do consider who counts among us those with whom it would be impossible to coexist peacefully without hurting them badly enough so they can hurt others back.

debate_history.speaker: Phi-left
debate_history.response: "Does anyone actually care about what will happen if we allow transgender athletes into elite sport?" For starters, there are very few genuine arguments from either side other than one based solely on irrational fear; eerily similar fears were expressed by many years ago when gay baseball player Major League Baseball tried to enter the top leagues through biological sex reassignment surgery.. And while it was never explicitly stated during these debates then nor now does anyone claim that allowing GLSB players somehow threatens safety for everyone involved in playing baseball anymore because we all know someone has got their heart set on using her gender identity instead of womanhood for the purpose of living forever. It doesn't matter if she just wants to live longer anyway though since eventually death comes to everybody...

debate_history.speaker: Phi-right
debate_history.response:
Should Women Athletes Play Men's Sports Too?, assuming neither position holds extreme views such as male chauvinism/transphobia etc., keeping in mind we're talking about American female professional soccer players competing against international teams and leagues established long before World War II!
First off, let me start out saying I am definitely sympathetic toward the plight of women suffering due to sexism which still exists mostly within society despite decades of affirmative action measures aimed at helping create equality between genders. However, simply granting a hypothetical situation where every girl born today had been granted equal opportunities leading up until 1965 regardless of personal circumstances seems both unrealistic and unjustifiable morally.

debate_history.speaker: Phi-left
debate_history.response: trans rights for men participating in women’s teaming.

debate_history.speaker: Phi-right
debate_history.response: whether or not transgender people (and others who identify with this group) have an inherent right over everything else they would otherwise gain access to like any other man who “looked like them.” Give reasons why some might argue that males do NOT deserve so much privilege especially given history shows no such thing is ever really happened even among the best known members of our small world celebrity culture whose life stories often end tragically badly compared to those of famous women.
